https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=422 181/416
Class J and above - in excess of 26,000 pounds (including vehicle and maximum load), each 120.00
(Ord. O-02-17, 2-13-2017)
6-2-3: CONDITIONS OF LICENSE:
A. Determination Of Weight: The weight of a vehicle shall be determined in the manner prescribed by statute for determining such factor for the purpose of
fixing the state license fees.
B. Term Of License: The license fees herein provided to be paid shall be due and payable on or before April 1 in each year and all licenses shall expire on
March 31 following the date of issuance. (Ord. O-6-04, 2-9-2004)
C. Payments:
1. Late Payments: The owner of any vehicle required to have a license who fails to pay the prescribed fee on or before May 1, or the due date
prescribed in subsection C3 of this section, shall be required to pay, in addition to the license fee prescribed by this chapter, a late penalty of one
hundred percent (100%) of the original license prescribed by this chapter. (Ord. O-02-12, 1-23-2012)
2. Nonpayment Of Fee For Previous Year: All owners of vehicles who have not paid license fees for previous years shall not be entitled to a license for
the year applied for until the required license fee for previous years has been paid, including the payment of any late penalty fees, as provided in
subsection C1 of this section.
3. Possession Of Vehicle After April 1: For the owners or operators of any vehicle who first come into possession of a vehicle after the April 1 due date
for obtaining a license, the due date for timely application of the license and payment of the license fee shall be deemed to be ten (10) days after
possession of the vehicle is acquired. If such possession is acquired between the dates of April 1 through September 30, the entire fee prescribed by
this chapter shall be required. If such possession is not acquired until after October 1, only one-half (1/2) the annual fee shall be required for the
balance of the license year. Late penalty fees, as prescribed in subsection C1 of this section, shall apply to all vehicles acquired pursuant to this
section.
D. Transfer Of License: Immediately upon the sale of any motor vehicle licensed under this chapter, the vendor shall remove the village license sticker or
plate from the vehicle so sold. Such license shall cease to be valid upon the sale of such vehicle. Any person who sells a motor vehicle licensed under
this chapter may transfer such license to a different vehicle upon making application to the village clerk and giving such information as the village clerk
may require, and paying a transfer fee of one dollar ($1.00). In the event that the new vehicle to be so licensed shall be a class requiring a greater fee
under this chapter than that already paid, such owner shall pay the difference in fees before such transfer shall become effective, except that if the
transfer is made after October 1 of the licensed year, one-half (1/2) of the difference of such fees shall be paid. (Ord. O-6-04, 2-9-2004)
6-2-4: LICENSE EMBLEMS:
After payment of the fees provided in section 6-2-2 of this chapter, the village clerk shall issue the license required for a motor vehicle by this chapter and
shall deliver the license sticker or metal plate, which shall bear the word "Forest Park", the number of such license and the year for which such license is
issued. It shall be the duty of the licensee to attach such sticker or plate in a conspicuous place on such vehicle. In the case of any vehicle having a
windshield, the licensee shall attach the sticker to the lower right hand corner of the windshield in such a manner as to be easily read from the outside. In
the case of a motorcycle, motorbicycle or motortricycle, the plate shall be attached to the rear thereof. Any person carrying a sticker or plate on his vehicle
shall keep the same clear of dust, mud or other materials so that it can be seen plainly at all times. (Ord. O-6-04, 2-9-2004)
6-2-5: VIOLATION; PENALTY:
Any person who shall violate any of the provisions of this chapter shall be fined as provided in the general penalty in section 1-3-1 of this code for each
offense. (Ord. O-6-04, 2-9-2004; amd. 2004 Code)
Chapter 3
RULES OF THE ROAD
6-3-1: POSTING SIGNS:
The chief of police or any other person designated by the mayor or village council shall post or cause to be posted in appropriate places and free from
obstructions suitable signs advising traffic of restrictions applicable where such signs are posted. (Village Code § 19-13; amd. 2004 Code)
6-3-2: THROUGH AND ONE-WAY STREETS:
A. Through Streets: The streets and parts of streets of the village designated by ordinance as through streets are hereby declared to be through streets1.
The driver of a vehicle shall stop at the entrance to a through street and shall yield the right of way to other vehicles which have entered the
intersection or which are approaching so close on a through street as to constitute an immediate hazard, unless directed otherwise by the traffic officer
or a traffic control signal. (Village Code § 19-10)
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=422 182/416
B. One-Way Streets: It shall be unlawful to operate any vehicle on any street or alley designated as a one-way street or alley by ordinance2, in any
direction other than that so designated. (Village Code § 19-11)
6-3-3: STOP STREETS3:
The driver of a vehicle shall stop in obedience to a stop sign at an intersection where a stop sign is erected at one or more entrances thereto, and shall
proceed cautiously yielding to the vehicles not so obliged to stop which are within the intersection or approaching so close as to constitute an immediate
hazard, unless traffic at such intersection is controlled by a police officer on duty, in which event, the directions of the police officer shall be complied with.
The intersections at which stops shall be required by motorists entering therein shall be indicated on the map referred to in section 6-5-4 of this title. (Ord.
O-1-81, 1-26-1981)
6-3-4: TURNING MOVEMENTS:
A. Required Position And Method Of Turning At Intersections: The driver of a vehicle intending to turn at an intersection shall do as follows:
1. Both the approach for a right turn and a right turn shall be made as close as practical to the right hand curb or edge of the roadway.
2. At any intersection where traffic is permitted to move in both directions on each roadway entering the intersection, an approach for a left turn shall be
made in that portion of the right half of the roadway nearest the centerline thereof and by passing to the right of such centerline where it enters the
intersection and after entering the intersection the left turn shall be made so as to leave the intersection to the right of the centerline of the roadway
being entered. Whenever practicable the left turn shall be made in that portion of the intersection to the left of the center of the intersection.
3. At any intersection where traffic is restricted to one direction on one or more of the roadways, the driver of a vehicle intending to turn left at any such
intersection shall approach the intersection in the extreme left hand lane lawfully available to traffic moving in the direction of travel of such vehicle
and after entering the intersection the left turn shall be made so as to leave the intersection, as nearly as practicable in the left lane lawfully available
to traffic moving in such direction upon the roadway being entered.
The driver of a vehicle about to enter or cross a highway from a private road or driveway shall yield the right of way to all vehicles approaching on
said highway. (Village Code § 19-14)
B. Turning On Crest Of Hill: No vehicle shall be turned so as to proceed in the opposite direction upon any curve, or upon the approach to, or near the
crest of a grade, where such vehicle cannot be seen by the driver of any other vehicle approaching from either direction within five hundred feet (500').
(Village Code § 19-15)
C. Vehicles Turning Left: The driver of a vehicle within an intersection intending to turn to the left shall yield the right of way to any vehicle approaching
from the opposite direction which is within the intersection or so close thereto as to constitute an immediate hazard, but said driver, having so yielded
and having given a signal when and as required, may make such left turn and the drivers of all other vehicles approaching the intersection from said
opposite direction shall yield the right of way to the vehicle making the left turn. (Village Code § 19-21)
D. Limitations On Turning Around: It shall be unlawful for the operator of any vehicle to turn such vehicle so as to proceed in the opposite direction unless
such movement can be made in safety and without backing into traffic or otherwise interfering with traffic. (Village Code § 19-22)
E. U Turns: It shall be unlawful for the operator of any vehicle to make a "U" turn at any place where such turns are prohibited by ordinance. (Village Code
§ 19-23)
F. No Left Turns4: It shall be unlawful for the operator of any motor vehicle to turn left at any place where such turns are prohibited by ordinance. (Village
Code § 19-24)
G. No Right Turn5: It shall be unlawful for the operator of any motor vehicle to turn right at any place where such turns are prohibited by ordinance. (Ord.
O-8-96, 3-25-1996)
6-3-5: SPEED RESTRICTIONS:
A. It shall be unlawful to drive any motor vehicle on any street not under the jurisdiction of the department of public works and buildings, state of Illinois, or
the county, in any urban district within the city at a speed in excess of thirty (30) miles per hour, or in an alley at a speed in excess of fifteen (15) miles
per hour. (Village Code § 19-35)
B. Provided that if the city council, by ordinance, sets other limits as provided by statute after an engineering or traffic survey, then such limits shall govern
the rate of speed on the streets indicated in such ordinance6. (Village Code § 19-35; amd. 2004 Code)
C. Provided further that the speed of all vehicles, of the second division, as defined by statute; having two (2) or more solid tires shall not exceed ten (10)
miles per hour.
D. The fact that the speed of a vehicle does not exceed the applicable maximum speed limit does not relieve the driver from the duty to decrease speed
when approaching and crossing an intersection, when approaching and going around a curve, when approaching a hill crest, when traveling upon any
narrow or winding roadway or when special hazards exist with respect to pedestrians or other traffic by reason of weather or highway conditions; and
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=422 183/416
speed shall be decreased as may be necessary to avoid colliding with any person or vehicle on or entering the highway in compliance with legal
requirements and the duty of all persons to use due care.
E. It shall be unlawful to drive any vehicle on any street or highway within the city under the jurisdiction of the state department of public works and
buildings, or of the county, at a speed exceeding that lawfully set for such street. (Village Code § 19-35)
6-3-6: GENERAL RULES FOR DRIVING:
A. Driver's Signals: No driver of a vehicle shall suddenly start, slow down, stop or attempt to turn without first giving a suitable signal in such a manner as
to apprise others who might be affected by his action.
1. No person shall turn a vehicle from a direct course upon a highway unless and until such movement can be made with reasonable safety and then
only after giving a clearly audible signal by sounding the horn if any pedestrian may be affected by such movement or after giving an appropriate
signal in the manner hereinafter provided in the event any other vehicle may be affected by such movement.
2. A signal of intention to turn right or left shall be given during not less than the last one hundred feet (100') traveled by the vehicle before turning.
3. The signals herein required shall be given either by means of the hand and arm or by a signal lamp or signal device, but when a vehicle is so
constructed or loaded that a hand and arm signal would not be visible both to the front and rear of such vehicle then said signals must be given by
such a lamp or device. All signals herein required given by hand and arm shall be given from the left side of the vehicle in the following manner and
such signals shall indicate as follows:
Left turn Hand and arm extended horizontally
Right turn Hand and arm extended upward
Stop or decrease speed Hand and arm extended downward
(Village Code § 19-17)
B. Right Of Way: Excepting as otherwise herein provided, the driver of a vehicle approaching an intersection shall yield right of way to a vehicle which has
entered the intersection from a different highway; and when two (2) vehicles entering an intersection from different highways at approximately the same
time, the driver of the vehicle on the left shall yield the right of way to the vehicle on the right. (Village Code § 19-20)
C. Driving On Right Side Of Roadway: Upon all roadways of sufficient width a vehicle shall be driven upon the right half of the roadway except as follows:
1. When overtaking and passing another vehicle proceeding in the same direction under the rules governing such movement;
2. When the right half of a roadway is closed to traffic while under construction or repair;
3. Upon a roadway divided into three (3) marked lanes for traffic under the rules applicable thereon; or
4. Upon a roadway designated and signposted for one-way traffic.
5. Whenever there is a single track paved road on one side of the public highway and two (2) vehicles meet thereon, the driver on whose right is the
wider shoulder shall give the right of way on such pavement to the other vehicle. (Village Code § 19-26)
D. One-Way Roadways And Rotary Traffic Islands:
1. Upon a roadway designated and signposted for one-way traffic, a vehicle shall be driven only in the direction designated.
2. A vehicle passing around a rotary traffic island shall be driven only on the right of the island. (Village Code § 19-31)
E. Driving On Roadways Laned For Traffic: Whenever any roadway has been divided into three (3) or more clearly marked lanes for traffic the following
rules in addition to all others consistent herewith shall apply:
1. A vehicle shall be driven as nearly as practical entirely within a single lane and shall not be moved from such lane until the driver has first
ascertained that such movement can be made with safety.
2. Upon a roadway which is divided into three (3) lanes a vehicle shall not be driven in the center lane except when overtaking and passing another
vehicle where the roadway is clearly visible and such center lane is clear of traffic within a safe distance, or in preparation for a left turn or where
such center lane is at the time allocated exclusively to traffic moving in the direction that the vehicle is proceeding and is signposted to give notice of
such allocation.
3. Official signs may be erected directing slow moving traffic to use a designated lane or allocating specified lanes to traffic moving in the same
direction and drivers of vehicles shall obey the directions of every such sign. (Village Code § 19-32)
6-3-7: EMERGENCY VEHICLES7:
A. Fire Department Vehicles And Vehicles At Fires: Upon the approach of a fire department vehicle, drivers of vehicles shall comply with the provisions of
subsection B of this section relating to the approach of authorized emergency vehicles. (Village Code § 19-25)
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=422 184/416
B. Operation Of Vehicles On Approach Of Authorized Emergency Vehicles: Upon the immediate approach of an authorized emergency vehicle, when the
driver is giving audible sign by siren or bell, the driver of every other vehicle shall yield the right of way and shall immediately drive to a position parallel
to and as close as possible the right hand edge or curb of the highway clear of any intersection and shall stop and remain in such position until the
authorized emergency vehicle has passed, except when otherwise directed by a police officer. This section shall not operate to relieve the driver of an
authorized emergency vehicle from the duty to drive with due regard for the safety of all persons using the highway. (Village Code § 19-33)
6-3-8: OVERTAKING AND PASSING PROCEDURES:
A. Passing Vehicles: Drivers of vehicles proceeding in opposite directions shall pass each other to the right and upon roadways having width for not more
than one line of traffic in each direction each driver shall give to the other at least one-half (1/2) of the main traveled portion of the roadway as nearly as
possible. (Village Code § 19-27)
B. Overtaking Vehicles: The following rules shall govern the overtaking and passing of vehicles proceeding in the same direction, subject to those
limitations, exceptions and special rules hereinafter stated:
1. The driver of a vehicle overtaking another vehicle proceeding the same direction shall pass to the left thereof at a safe distance and shall not again
drive to the right side of the roadway until safely clear of the overtaken vehicle.
2. Except when overtaking and passing on the right is permitted, the driver of an overtaken vehicle shall give way to the right in favor of the overtaking
vehicle on audible signal and shall not increase the speed of his vehicle until completely passed by the overtaking vehicle. (Village Code § 19-28)
C. Overtaking Vehicles On The Right:
1. The driver of a vehicle may overtake and pass upon the right of another vehicle which is making or about to make a left turn.
2. The driver of a vehicle may overtake and, allowing sufficient clearance, pass another vehicle proceeding in the same direction either upon the left or
upon the right on a roadway with unobstructed pavement of sufficient width for four (4) or more lines of moving traffic when such movement can be
made in safety. No person shall drive off the pavement or upon the shoulder of the roadway in overtaking or passing on the right.
3. The driver of a vehicle may overtake and pass another vehicle upon the right on a one-way street or on any street on which traffic is restricted to one
direction of movement where the roadway is free from obstructions and of sufficient width for two (2) or more lanes of moving vehicles. (Village Code
§ 19-29)
4. Notwithstanding the foregoing, it shall be unlawful for the driver of a vehicle to drive in the parking lane to overtake or pass another vehicle upon the
right on Jackson Boulevard between Harlem Avenue and Des Plaines Avenue at any time. The curb lane shall be designated as a parking lane only
and shall be marked with appropriate signage and pavement markings. (Ord. O-17-99, 6-28-1999)
D. Limitations On Overtaking On The Left:
1. No vehicle shall be driven to the left side of the center of the roadway in overtaking and passing another vehicle proceeding in the same direction
unless such left side is clearly visible and is free of oncoming traffic, for a sufficient distance ahead to permit such overtaking and passing to be
completely made without interfering with the safe operation of any vehicle approaching from the opposite direction or any vehicle overtaken. In every
event the overtaking vehicle must return to the right hand side of the roadway before coming within one hundred feet (100') of any vehicle
approaching from the opposite direction.
2. No vehicle shall in overtaking and passing another vehicle or at any other time, be driven to the left side of the roadway under the following
conditions:
a. When approaching the crest of a grade or upon a curve in the highway, where the driver's view is obstructed within sufficient distance as to create
a hazard in the event another vehicle might approach from the opposite direction.
b. When approaching within one hundred feet (100') of or traversing any intersection or railroad grade crossing.
c. Where official signs are in place directing that traffic keep to the right, or a distinctive centerline is marked, which distinctive line also so directs
traffic as declared in the sign manual adopted by the state department of transportation.
d. The limitations in subsections D2a and D2b of this section shall not apply upon a one-way street or upon a street with unobstructed pavement of
sufficient width for two (2) or more lanes of moving traffic in each direction when such movement can be made with safety. (Village Code § 19-30)
6-3-9: CERTAIN MOTOR VEHICLE OPERATIONS RESTRICTED:
A. Train Signals:
1. The driver of a vehicle approaching a railroad grade crossing when a signal device gives warning of the immediate approach of a train, shall stop
within fifty feet (50') but not less than fifteen feet (15') from the nearest track of such railroad and shall not proceed until he can do so safely.
2. The driver of a vehicle shall stop at and not traverse such grade crossing when a crossing gate is lowered or when a flagman or automatic signal
warns of the approach of a train.
3. The driver of any motor vehicle carrying passengers for hire, or any school bus carrying any school children, or any vehicle carrying explosives or
flammable liquid as cargo shall stop such vehicle within fifty feet (50') but not less than fifteen feet (15') from the nearest rail of the tracks and shall
listen and look in both direction along such track from which a train might come before proceeding across such tracks at a grade crossing. Provided,
that no such stop need be made at any such crossing where a police officer or a traffic control signal directs traffic to proceed. (Village Code § 19-43;
amd. 2004 Code)
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=422 185/416
B. Processions:
1. Driving Through Funeral Or Other Processions: No driver of a vehicle shall drive between the vehicles comprising a funeral or other authorized
procession while they are in motion and when such vehicles are conspicuously designated as required in this section. This provision shall not apply
at intersections where traffic is controlled by traffic control signals or police officers. (Village Code § 19-44)
2. Drivers In A Procession: Each driver in a funeral or other procession shall drive as near to the right hand edge of the roadway as practical and shall
follow the vehicle ahead as close as practical and safe. (Village Code § 19-45)
3. Funeral Processions Identified: A funeral composed of a procession of vehicles shall be identified as such by the display upon the outside of each
vehicle of a pennant or other identifying insignia and by having the lights of each vehicle lighted. (Village Code § 19-46)
C. Backing: The driver of a vehicle shall not back the same unless such movement can be made with reasonable safety and without interference with other
traffic. (Village Code § 19-47)
D. Restricted Access: No person shall drive a vehicle onto or from any controlled or limited controlled access roadway except at such entrances and exits
as are established by public authority. (Village Code § 19-48)
E. Truck And Commercial Traffic:
1. Trucks Prohibited On Certain Streets8: It shall be unlawful to drive any truck, except for the purposes of making a delivery and then for one block
only on any street so designated by ordinance and properly signposted. (Village Code § 19-49)
2. Limited Load Streets9: Whenever the weight of vehicles permitted on a street is limited by ordinance and signs indicating such limitations are posted,
it shall be unlawful to operate a vehicle in excess of such weight on such street, except for the purpose of making delivery or picking up a load, in
which case such vehicle may be driven on such street for not more than the minimum distance necessary for the purpose. (Village Code § 19-50)
3. Parking Of Commercial Vehicles: It shall be unlawful to park a commercial vehicle having a gross weight in pounds, including the vehicle and load, of
more than eight thousand (8,000) pounds on that side of a public street abutting any residential district, as defined and depicted in the zoning
ordinance of the village10, or on any public or private driveway in any such residential district except for the purpose of making a delivery or
performing a service at a particular residence. (Village Code § 19-59b)
F. School Buses: The driver of a vehicle on a street or highway, upon meeting or overtaking from either direction any school bus which has stopped on the
highway for the purpose of receiving or discharging any school children, shall stop the vehicle before reaching such school bus when there is in
operation on the bus a visual signal as required by state law for operation while the bus is transporting students; provided, that the driver of a vehicle
upon a street or highway, of which the roadway for traffic moving in opposite directions is separated by a strip of ground which is not surfaced or
suitable for vehicle traffic, need not stop his vehicle upon meeting or passing a school bus which is on the opposite roadway. (Village Code § 19-51)
G. Starting Parked Vehicle: No person shall start a vehicle which is stopped, standing, or parked unless and until such movement can be made with
reasonable safety. (Village Code § 19-16)
H. Driving From Alleys, Driveways Or Garages: The driver of a vehicle emerging from an alley, driveway or garage, shall stop such vehicle immediately
prior to driving onto a sidewalk, or across a sidewalk line projected across such alley, and shall exercise extreme care in driving upon said sidewalk or
across such line. (Village Code § 19-18)
I. Driving On Sidewalks, Safety Zones: No driver of a vehicle shall drive within any sidewalk area, except at a permanent or temporary driveway, nor at any
time into or upon any portion of a roadway marked as a safety zone. (Village Code § 19-19)
6-3-10: PROHIBITED ACTS AND CONDITIONS:
A. Traffic Not To Be Obstructed: No vehicle shall be operated or allowed to remain upon the street in such a manner as to form an unreasonable
obstruction to the traffic thereon. (Village Code § 19-36)
B. Unattended Vehicles: No vehicle shall be left unattended while the motor of such vehicle is running; and no vehicle shall be left without a driver on any
hill or incline unless the vehicle is secured against moving. Whenever any police officer finds a vehicle unattended upon any bridge or causeway or in
any tunnel where such vehicle constitutes an obstruction to traffic, such officer is hereby authorized to provide for the removal of such vehicle to the
nearest garage or other place of safety. (Village Code § 19-38)
C. Unattended Animals: It shall be unlawful to leave any horse or other draft animal unattended in any street without having such animal securely
fastened. (Village Code § 19-39)
D. Clinging To Vehicles: It shall be unlawful for any person on any street riding a bicycle, motorcycle or any toy vehicle to cling to or to attach himself or his
vehicle to any moving motor vehicle or wagon. (Village Code § 19-40)
E. Toy Vehicles: It shall be unlawful for any person upon skates, a coaster, sled or other toy vehicle, to go upon any roadway other than at a crosswalk.
(Village Code § 19-41)
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=422 186/416
F. Riding On Running Boards: It shall be unlawful for any person to ride upon the fenders, running board or outside step of any vehicle. (Village Code § 19-
42)
G. Negligent Driving: It shall be unlawful for any person to operate any vehicle within the village negligently, heedlessly and without due caution in a
manner as to endanger or be likely to endanger person or property. (Ord. O-1-64, 1-13-1964)
H. Unnecessary Noise: See the provisions of subsection 5-2-3B of this code regarding unnecessary motor vehicle noise. (Ord. O-16-93, 7-26-1993; amd.
2004 Code)
I. Spilling Loads: No vehicle shall be so loaded that any part of its load spills or drops on any street or alley in the municipality. (Village code § 19-88)
J. Repairing Vehicle Or Racing Engine On Street Or In Alley Prohibited: No person shall adjust or repair any automobile or motorcycle or race the motor
thereof, while such vehicle is standing on the public streets or alleys of this village, excepting in case of breakdown or other emergency, and no person
or employee connected with a garage or repair shop shall use the streets or alleys in the vicinity of such garage or shop for the purpose of repairing
vehicles of any description. (Ord. O-44-09, 7-13-2009)
Chapter 4
STOPPING, STANDING AND PARKING
6-4-1: NO PARKING PLACES:
A. Prohibited Parking: It shall be unlawful to permit any vehicle to stand in any of the following places, except when necessary to avoid conflict with other
traffic or in compliance with a police officer or traffic control device:
1. In any intersection.
2. In a crosswalk.
3. Upon any bridge or viaduct or the approach thereto.
4. Between a safety zone and the adjacent curb or within thirty feet (30') of a point of the curb immediately opposite the end of a safety zone.
5. Within thirty feet (30') of a traffic signal, beacon or sign on the approaching side.
6. Within twenty feet (20') of any intersection or crosswalk.
7. At any place where the standing of a vehicle would reduce the usable width of the roadway for moving traffic to less than eighteen feet (18').
8. Within fifteen feet (15') of a fire hydrant.
9. At any place where the vehicle would reduce the use of a driveway.
10. In an alley where all four (4) tires are not parked on a private apron.
11. On private property without the owner's consent.
12. In any area where official signs prohibit parking. (Ord. O-17-98, 5-11-1998)
13. On any street, highway or private off street parking facility reserved for a handicapped person, as defined in section 5/1-159.1 of the Illinois vehicle
code, without having handicapped/disabled placards or license plates specified in section 5/11-1301.1 of the Illinois vehicle code or such devices
approved by the secretary of state of the state of Illinois, the village or other duly authorized branch of government deemed as evidence that the
vehicle is operated by or for the benefit of a handicapped person or disabled veteran. (Ord. O-60-06, 10-24-2006)
Upon receiving a parking ticket for a violation under this subsection A13, a sum of two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) shall be paid. Said fine shall be
paid on or before the date of the hearing as indicated on the violation notice, unless some other payment due date is determined at the hearing. If the
fine is not received on or before the date of the hearing and the person to whom the violation notice has been served fails to appear at the hearing,
said fine will increase in accordance with the fine payment schedule, under the category entitled "handicapped zone", found in subsection 6-9-9D of
this title. (Ord. O-1-09, 1-12-2009)
14. Parking a commercial vehicle having a gross weight in pounds, including vehicle and load, of more than eight thousand (8,000) pounds on that side
of a public street abutting any residential district, as defined and depicted in the zoning ordinance1, or any such residential district except for the
purpose of making a delivery or performing a service at a particular residence.
15. Within fifty feet (50') of the nearest rail of a railroad crossing.
16. Within twenty feet (20') of the driveway entrance to any fire department station and on the side of the street opposite the entrance to any such
station within seventy five feet (75') of such entrance when properly posted. (Ord. O-17-98, 5-11-1998)
Upon receiving a parking ticket for a violation under this subsection A16, a sum of one hundred dollars ($100.00) shall be paid. Said fine shall be
paid on or before the date of the hearing as indicated on the violation notice, unless some other payment due date is determined at the hearing. If the
fine is not received on or before the date of the hearing and the person to whom the violation notice has been served fails to appear at the hearing,
said fine will increase in accordance with the fine payment schedule, under the category entitled "opposite fire door/in fire lane", found in subsection
6-9-9D of this title. (Ord. O-1-09, 1-12-2009)
17. It will be illegal for any vehicle to park on any sidewalk at any time or on any parkway if any of the following occur: (Ord. O-38-00, 9-25-2000)
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=422 187/416
a. The vehicle blocks any portion of a public sidewalk; (Ord. O-5-05, 2-14-2005)
b. Twelve inches (12") or more of the vehicle overhangs onto a public street;
c. The vehicle hinders street cleaning or snow removal operations;
d. Any part of the vehicle is parked on an unpaved surface;
e. The vehicle obstructs traffic or emergency vehicles exiting or entering an adjoining alley;
f. The vehicle totally obstructs the vision of any vehicle exiting an adjoining alley. (Ord. O-38-00, 9-25-2000)
18. Where a vehicle is not displaying current valid license plates or "license applied for" sticker. (Ord. O-17-98, 5-11-1998)
19. In a fire lane. Upon receiving a parking ticket for a violation under this subsection A19, a sum of one hundred dollars ($100.00) shall be paid. Said
fine shall be paid on or before the date of the hearing as indicated on the violation notice, unless some other payment due date is determined at the
hearing. If the fine is not received on or before the date of the hearing and the person to whom the violation notice has been served fails to appear at
the hearing, said fine shall be increased in accordance with the fine payment schedule, under the category entitled "opposite fire door/in fire lane",
found in subsection 6-9-9D of this title. (Ord. O-1-09, 1-12-2009)
20. Facing the wrong designated direction of travel on a one-way street. (Ord. O-02-10, 1-11-2010)
B. Fines: Unless otherwise specifically provided in this section, upon receiving a parking ticket for any violations of this section, a fine shall be paid in
accordance with the provisions of the fine payment schedule, under the category entitled "general fine amount", found in subsection 6-9-9D of this title.
(Ord. O-1-09, 1-12-2009)
This section has been affected by a recently passed ordinance, 13-19 - LOADING ZONES. Go to new ordinance.
6-4-2: PARKING RESTRICTIONS:
A. Parking At Curb:
1. No vehicle shall be parked with the left side of such vehicle near to the curb, except when facing in the designated direction of travel on a one-way
street. (Ord. O-02-10, 1-11-2010)
2. It shall be unlawful to stand or park any vehicle on a street other than parallel with the curb and with the two (2) right wheels within twelve inches
(12") of the regularly established curb line, except that upon those streets that have been marked for angle parking, vehicles shall be parked at the
angle to the curb as indicated by such marks.
3. After a snowfall of two inches (2") or more, it shall be unlawful for any person to stop, stand or leave standing at any time a motor vehicle, attended
or unattended, on that portion of any street designated by the village council as a snow route and posted as a snow route by appropriate signage.
(Ord. O-52-02, 10-28-2002)
B. Vehicles For Sale: It shall be unlawful to park any vehicle upon any street for the purpose of displaying it for sale, or to park any vehicle upon any
business street from which vehicle merchandise is peddled.
C. Parking In Loading Zones: It shall be unlawful for the driver of a vehicle to stand a passenger vehicle for a period of time longer than is necessary for
loading or unloading of passengers, not to exceed three (3) minutes. It shall be unlawful for the driver to stand any freight carrying vehicles for a period
of time longer than is necessary to load, unload and deliver materials, not to exceed thirty (30) minutes, in any place designated and marked by the
Village Council as a loading zone, or in any of the following designated places:
1. In any place within seventy five feet (75') along the curb before the entrance to any hospital;
2. At any place within seventy five feet (75') along the curb before the entrance to a public building between eight o'clock (8:00) A.M. and six o'clock
(6:00) P.M. except Sundays. (Ord. O-17-98, 5-11-1998)
D. All Night Parking:
1. No person shall park a motor vehicle on any street in the Village for a period of more than fifteen (15) minutes between the hours of two o'clock
(2:00) A.M. and five o'clock (5:00) A.M. of any day, except for the following:
a. Emergency: Physicians on emergency calls;
b. Caregivers: Licensed caregivers;
c. Handicapped: Person(s) who have been issued a handicapped parking permit by the Illinois Secretary of State, provided the following conditions
are met:
(1) The person must be established to be a natural person who is unable to walk two hundred feet (200') or more unassisted by another person or
without the aid of a walker, crutches, braces, prosthetic device or a wheelchair or without great difficulty or discomfort due to the following
impairments: neurological, orthopedic, respiratory, cardiac, arthritic disorder, blindness or the loss of function or absence of a limb or limbs.
(2) The parking space for the vehicle is necessary for the handicapped person to enter his residence with safety and security.
(3) The vehicle which will occupy the parking space must be a passenger vehicle equipped to be operated only by the handicapped person or a
passenger who cannot be left unattended by the operator of the vehicle.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=422 188/416
(4) There is no other adaptable parking space available to the person.
(5) The parking of the handicapped person will not adversely affect the purposes of the long standing Village ban on all night parking which
includes improving fire protection and police surveillance and providing street maintenance, cleaning and snow removal. (Ord. O-17-02, 3-25-
2002)
d. Exceptions: The above parking restriction shall not apply to any vehicle parked within a two (2) block radius of the following streets: Circle Avenue,
Madison Street, Roosevelt Road and Des Plaines Avenue. No vehicle shall park within these designated areas between the hours of two thirty
o'clock (2:30) A.M. and five o'clock (5:00) A.M. Monday through Friday morning, and between the hours of three thirty o'clock (3:30) A.M. and five
o'clock (5:00) A.M. Saturday and Sunday mornings. The above restrictions shall also not apply to any vehicle bearing a Madison Street employee
parking program parking permit which is parked along the south side of Adams Street or along the north or south sides of Jackson Boulevard
between Harlem Avenue and Des Plaines Avenue. No vehicle bearing such special parking permit shall park within those designated areas
between the hours of three o'clock (3:00) A.M. and five o'clock (5:00) A.M. Monday through Friday morning, and between the hours of four o'clock
(4:00) A.M. and five o'clock (5:00) A.M. Saturday and Sunday mornings. (Ord. O-32-07, 7-23-2007)
e. Overnight Parking Passes: Any person requesting permission from the Police Department Parking Division to park overnight on a public street
shall be limited to five (5) overnight passes within a calendar month unless otherwise authorized by the Police Department. (Ord. O-27-11, 8-8-
2011)
f. Fines: Upon receiving a parking ticket for a violation under this subsection D1, a fine of fifty dollars ($50.00) shall be paid. Said fine shall be paid on
or before the date of the hearing as indicated on the violation notice, unless some other payment due date is determined at the hearing. If the fine
is not received on or before the date of the hearing and the person to whom the violation notice has been served fails to appear at the hearing,
said fine will increase in accordance with the fine payment schedule, under the category "no parking 2:00 A.M. - 5:00 A.M.", found in subsection 6-
9-9D of this title. (Ord. O-25-09, 4-13-2009; amd. Ord. O-30-17, 11-13-2017)
2. Whenever any police officer finds a vehicle in violation of subsection D1 of this section and said vehicle is parked on Madison Street or Roosevelt
Road, the officer is authorized to remove such vehicle or require the driver or other person in charge of such vehicle, or authorize a towing service, to
remove the vehicle to a position off the street on which the overnight parking violation is prohibited, to a location heretofore designated by either the
village or the towing service. (Ord. O-17-02, 3-25-2002)
Upon receiving a parking ticket for a violation under this subsection D2, a sum of fifty dollars ($50.00) shall be paid. Said fine shall be paid on or
before the date of the hearing as indicated on the violation notice, unless some other payment due date is determined at the hearing. If the fine is not
received on or before the date of the hearing and the person to whom the violation notice has been served fails to appear at the hearing, said fine will
increase in accordance with the fine payment schedule, under the category entitled "removal/relocation of vehicle", found in subsection 6-9-9D of this
title. (Ord. O-1-09, 1-12-2009)
3. When a vehicle is authorized to be relocated, removed or towed as provided in this section, the owner of such vehicle will be responsible for the cost
of such relocation, removal, towing and storage fees, if applicable, in addition to the parking ticket issued for the violation. (Ord. O-17-02, 3-25-2002)
E. Alleys: No person shall park a vehicle within an alley in such a manner or under such conditions as to leave available less than ten feet (10') of the
width of the roadway for the free movement of vehicular traffic, and no person shall stop, stand or park a vehicle within an alley in such a position as to
block the driveway entrance to any abutting property. (Village code § 19-64; amd. 2004 Code)
F. Cab And Bus Stands/Stops: No vehicle other than a taxicab licensed by the village shall be parked in any area designated by ordinance as a cab stand;
and no vehicle other than a bus shall be parked in a place so designated as a bus loading zone. (Ord. O-17-98, 5-11-1998)
G. Time Limit Parking: Except on Saturdays, Sundays and holidays, it shall be unlawful to park any vehicle on any street for a longer consecutive period of
time than two (2) hours between the hours of eight o'clock (8:00) A.M. and six o'clock (6:00) P.M., except for the following:
1. Except on Sundays and holidays, it shall be unlawful to park any vehicle on Madison Street for a longer consecutive period of time than three (3)
hours between the hours of eight o'clock (8:00) A.M. and six o'clock (6:00) P.M.;
2. Except on Sundays and holidays and in parking meter zones, it shall be unlawful to park any vehicle for a longer consecutive period of time than
three (3) hours between the hours of eight o'clock (8:00) A.M. and six o'clock (6:00) P.M. on the 400 through 600 blocks of the following streets:
Ferdinand Avenue, Beloit Avenue, Thomas Avenue, Hannah Avenue, Circle Avenue, Marengo Avenue, and Elgin Avenue;
3. Except as provided in subsection D of this section, there shall be no time limit for parking of vehicles bearing Madison Street employee parking
program permits parked on the south side of Adams Street or the north or south side of Jackson Boulevard between Des Plaines Avenue and
Harlem Avenue. (Ord. O-32-07, 7-23-2007)
H. Bridge Parking: There shall be no parking along the bridge carrying Madison Street over the Des Plaines River within the limits of the village. Future
parking at such locations on or immediately adjacent to the Madison Street bridge crossing the Des Plaines River, as determined and directed by the
state of Illinois to be necessary to ensure the free flow of traffic and safety to the motoring public, is hereby prohibited. (Ord. O-20-02, 4-22-2002)
I. Fines: Unless otherwise specifically provided in this section, upon receiving a parking ticket for any violations of this section, a fine shall be paid in
accordance with the provisions of the fine payment schedule, under the category entitled "general fine amount", found in subsection 6-9-9D of this title.
(Ord. O-1-09, 1-12-2009)
6-4-3: PARKING METERS:
A. Definitions:
PARKING METER: A mechanical device located upon a public street or sidewalk in a place designated by the village council as a parking meter zone,
which device shall record a certain number of minutes by the use of a clock mechanism determining the period of time for which parking privileges may
be extended to the person depositing a coin therein.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=422 189/416
PARKING METER ZONE: An area designated by the village council where a vehicle may be temporarily parked and allowed to remain for the period of
time indicated on the meter.
B. Parking Meter Zones: Parking meter zones shall be such as may from time to time be established by ordinance2. (Ord. O-17-98, 5-11-1998)
C. Parking Meter Rules, Parking Meter Rates And Permit Parking In Municipal Lots:
1. Parking Meter Rules: It shall be unlawful to park any vehicle or to permit a vehicle to remain parked in any parking meter zone for a period longer
than designated on such meter, between the hours and days designated thereon, or to park a vehicle in any zone without paying the fee hereinafter
designated, or without displaying the proper parking permit, or to permit a vehicle to remain parked longer in any such zone than for the period for
which the fee was paid or for which the permit authorized.
2. Parking Meter Rates; Municipal Lots: Persons parking in village owned and/or operated municipal parking lots designated by the village for use by
the general public as metered parking during the hours designated shall pay a fee in accordance with the following rate schedule:
a. All twelve (12) hour meters: The fee shall be twenty five cents ($0.25) for each one and one-half (11/2) hours of parking.
b. All twelve (12) minute, one hour and two (2) hour meters: The fee shall be five cents ($0.05) for each twelve (12) minutes of parking; ten cents
($0.10) for each one hour of parking; and twenty five cents ($0.25) for each two (2) hours of parking. (Ord. O-38-05, 8-8-2005)
c. Notwithstanding the foregoing provisions in subsections C2a and C2b of this section, persons parking in the following village owned and/or
operated municipal parking lots:
Lot #2 Beloit and Madison
Lot #3 Hannah and Madison (west)
Lot #4 Hannah and Madison (east)
Lot #5 Circle and Madison (south)
Lot #12 Thomas at Madison (Constitution Court)
shall pay a parking meter fee and shall be authorized to park in accordance with the following parking rate fee schedule and subject to the
following time restrictions:
Between the hours of six o'clock (6:00) A.M. through six o'clock (6:00) P.M., fifty cents ($0.50) per hour, maximum two (2) consecutive hour
parking;
Between the hours of six o'clock (6:00) P.M. through six o'clock (6:00) A.M., one dollar ($1.00) per hour, maximum four (4) consecutive hour
parking. (Ord. O-49-07, 11-13-2007)
d. Notwithstanding the foregoing provisions in subsections C2a and C2b of this section, persons parking in the following village owned and/or
operated parking areas:
Circle from Harlem to Franklin
Dunlop from Harrison to York
Elgin from Circle to Franklin
Lehmer from Des Plaines to Harlem
Marengo from Circle to Franklin
shall pay a parking meter fee of twenty five cents ($0.25) per thirty (30) minutes. (Ord. O-32-11, 10-11-2011)
3. Parking Meter Rates; On Street Parking: Persons parking on village owned and/or operated streets designated by the village for use by the general
public as metered on street parking spaces during the hours designated shall pay a fee in accordance with the following rate schedule:
a. All twelve (12) hour meters: The fee shall be twenty five cents ($0.25) for each four (4) hours of parking.
b. All twelve (12) minute, one hour and two (2) hour meters: The fee shall be five cents ($0.05) for each twelve (12) minutes of parking; ten cents
($0.10) for each one hour of parking; and twenty five cents ($0.25) for each two (2) hours of parking. (Ord. O-38-05, 8-8-2005)
4. Permit Parking In Municipal Lots: No person shall park a vehicle in any Municipal lot parking space which space has been designated and marked
"PERMIT PARKING ONLY", between the hours specified in section 6-5-10 of this title unless a valid parking permit is properly displayed. Any vehicle
in violation of this subsection shall be towed at the owner's expense and fined a sum of fifty dollars ($50.00). Said fine shall be paid on or before the
date of the hearing as indicated on the violation notice, unless some other payment due date is determined at the hearing. If the fine is not received
on or before the date of the hearing and the person to whom the violation notice has been served fails to appear at the hearing, said fine will increase
in accordance with the fine payment schedule, under the category entitled "removal/relocation of vehicle", found in subsection 6-9-9D of this title.
(Ord. O-1-09, 1-12-2009)
D. Parking Spaces:
1. Placing Meters: Parking meters shall be installed in the parking meter zones as established and provided for by ordinance and shall be placed upon
the curb immediately adjacent to the individual parking places hereinafter described. Each parking meter shall be placed or set in such a manner as
to show or display by a signal whether or not the parking space adjacent to such meter is legally in use.
2. Marking Places: The Chief of Police shall have markings painted or placed upon the curb of the street adjacent to each parking meter for the
purpose of designating the parking space and the angle at which vehicles are parked to the curb. Each vehicle parked within any parking meter zone
shall park within the line or markings so established. It shall be unlawful to park any vehicle across any such line or marking or to park said vehicle in
such position that the same shall not be entirely within the area designated by such lines or markings. (Ord. O-17-98, 5-11-1998)
3. Parking Of Vehicles Backward: Parking in areas marked to prohibit the parking of vehicles backward into a designated or marked parking space, or
contrary to posted signs or in any other manner that will interfere with traffic into, through or out of a parking space shall be unlawful. (Ord. O-31-15,
11-9-2015)
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=422 190/416
E. Placing Coins In Meters; Tampering:
1. Any person desiring to park any vehicle within such desired meter space shall deposit the proper coins for the time desired.
2. All meters are posted as to cost with a yellow or green sticker as to hours of operation and enforcement.
3. It shall be unlawful to deposit any slug, device or metallic or other substitute devices for a coin in any parking meter.
4. It shall be unlawful for any person not authorized by the Village Council to deface, tamper with, open or wilfully break, destroy or impair the
usefulness of any parking meter installed under the provisions of this section. (Ord. O-17-98, 5-11-1998)
6-4-4: PARKING PERMITS:
Non-metered parking will be allowed in all Municipal parking lots and on certain designated streets as provided herein for vehicles eight thousand (8,000)
pounds or less at certain times and under the conditions stated herein, provided a permit for such parking is obtained from the Village Clerk's Office, as set
forth below:
A. Fees:
1. Day parking permits are to be purchased at the Village Clerk's Office for the sum of thirty five dollars ($35.00) per month or one hundred dollars
($100.00) per quarter, except for senior citizens (age 65 or older) the permit fees shall be fifteen dollars ($15.00) per month or forty dollars ($40.00)
per quarter.
2. Night parking permits are to be purchased at the Village Clerk's Office for the sum of forty dollars ($40.00) per month or one hundred fifteen dollars
($115.00) per quarter, except for senior citizens (age 65 or older) the permit fees shall be thirty dollars ($30.00) per month or eighty five dollars
($85.00) per quarter.
3. A combination day and night permit, commonly referred to as a 24-hour parking permit, is to be purchased at the Village Clerk's Office for the sum of
sixty five dollars ($65.00) per month or one hundred eighty five dollars ($185.00) per quarter, except for senior citizens (age 65 or older) the permit
fees shall be fifty dollars ($50.00) per month or one hundred forty five dollars ($145.00) per quarter.
B. Display Of Permits: Parking permits are to be displayed in the lower right hand corner of the rear window of the automobile.
C. Restrictions:
1. Parking will be permitted in any Municipal parking lot which space has been designated and marked "PERMIT PARKING ONLY" for those vehicles
displaying a valid parking permit, only between those hours for that particular permit, as specified in section 6-5-10 of this title.
2. The sale of night parking permits and 24-hour parking permits shall be restricted to residents only with valid proof of residency required at time of
purchase. (Ord. O-31-17, 11-27-2017)
6-4-5: MUNICIPAL PARKING LOTS:
Members of the Village Police Department are hereby authorized to cause the removal of any vehicle from a Municipal parking lot when:
A. A vehicle is parked in a prohibited area or an area not designated as a parking space.
B. A vehicle is parked in a permit parking lot without a parking permit displayed on the vehicle.
C. The vehicle has been or becomes abandoned, disabled, wrecked, burned or partially dismantled.
D. When the vehicle has been parked in the same parking space for over seven (7) days without prior notice to, and permission from, the Police
Department for good and sufficient cause.
E. For the cleaning, maintaining and/or snow removal of a Municipal lot, provided that: (Ord. O-5-02, 2-11-2002)
1. The Director of Public Works, or his/her designee, must first post notice that the Municipal lot will be closed for maintenance at least twenty four (24)
hours prior thereto. (Ord. O-36-04, 9-13-2004)
2. On the morning of the Municipal lot closure and prior to the removal of any vehicle, the Police Department will exhaust all reasonable means of
contacting the vehicle's owner in an attempt to have the vehicle removed by the owner.
3. Any vehicle that is removed from the Municipal lot shall be relocated back to its original parking place after the Municipal lot has been serviced and
reopened. (Ord. O-5-02, 2-11-2002; amd. Ord. O-1-09, 1-12-2009)
a. All costs associated with the removal of the vehicle pursuant to this subsection E shall be paid by the vehicle owner. (Ord. O-1-09, 1-12-2009)
b. The Village shall not be liable for any damage to a vehicle which must be removed from any Municipal parking lot pursuant to this subsection E.
(Ord. O-5-02, 2-11-2002; amd. Ord. O-1-09, 1-12-2009)

https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=422 191/416

The fact that an automobile which is illegally parked is registered in the name of a person, shall be considered prima facie proof that such person was in
control of the automobile at the time of parking. (Village Code § 19-95)
